sentence: The four-page letter was signed by Reps. Andy Biggs of Arizona; Chip Roy of Texas; Cliff Bentz of Oregon; Dan Bishop of North Carolina; Darrell Issa of California; Jim Jordan of Ohio; Ken Buck of Colorado; Louie Gohmert of Texas; Matt Gaetz of Florida; Michelle Fischbach of Minnesota; Mike Johnson of Louisiana; Scott Fitzgerald of Wisconsin; Tom McClintock of California; Tom Tiffany of Wisconsin; W. Gregory Steube of Florida and Victoria Spartz of Indiana.
author: Emily Zantow
title: House Republicans press DOJ on ‘racial discrimination’ in COVID-19 treatment policies

sentence: “I’m not aware of what his intention is.” Rep. Rodney Davis (R-Ill.), the party’s top member on the committee with jurisdiction over Capitol security, said: “Look, it’s gonna depend upon what Leader McCarthy wants.” Davis was one of McCarthy’s picks to sit on the select committee before he decided to boycott the panel over Pelosi’s refusal to seat two other Republican selections — Banks and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio).
title: The GOP’s Jan. 6 committee dilemma: Disband it, or turn it on Dems?

sentence: Make America Great Again!” When Pelosi launched her January 6 committee, McCarthy recommended that Rep. Jim Banks (R-IN) and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) serve as Republican members.
author: Ben Zeisloft
title: McCarthy Endorses Cheney’s Republican Challenger

sentence: Representative Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) said that the decision would undoubtedly lead to more chaos and harm at the border: Democrats want to end Title 42 at the southern border.
title: Immigration Arrests and Deportations Plummet During Biden's First Year

author: Tyler Olson
title: Over 50 House Republicans back Banks' resolution opposing Iran nuclear deal amid Russia-Ukraine war

sentence: In letters posted on Twitter, 10 Republicans, led by Rep. Jim Jordan, the ranking member of the House Judiciary Committee, wrote to Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Parag Agrawal, Twitter's CEO.
author: Jeffrey Rodack
title: House Republicans Probing Big Tech 'Suppression' of Hunter Biden Laptop Story

sentence: "Jim Jordan, my colleagues and I are ready to see this through to the end."
author: Andrew Mark Miller
title: House Republicans send letter to Hunter Biden law firm seeking preservation of records

sentence: “Jim Jordan, my colleagues and I are ready to see this through to the end.” The article goes on to state the following: In the letter, the House Republicans reference a bombshell report from the New York Post published in the weeks leading up to the 2020 presidential election detailing the contents of Hunter Biden’s laptop that suggested he was using his father’s position of power for his own financial gain.
author: DML News App
title: REPORT: House Republicans put Hunter Biden’s legal team on notice over business dealings

sentence: According to a Friday letter seen by CNBC, House Judiciary Committee Republicans led by ranking member Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) have asked Twitter board chairman Bret Taylor to preserve any communications from both official and personal accounts – including those sent using encryption – that have anything to do with Musk’s offer.”
author: Glenn Reynolds
title: House Republicans Demand Twitter Board Preserve All Records Related To Musk Buyout Bid.

sentence: Article content “As Congress continues to examine Big Tech and how to best protect Americans’ free speech rights, this letter serves as a formal request that you preserve all records and materials relating to Musk’s offer to purchase Twitter, including Twitter’s consideration and response to this offer, and Twitter’s evaluation of its shareholder interests with respect to Musk’s offer,” said the letter signed by the top Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, Jim Jordan, and others on the committee.
author: David Shepardson
title: House Republicans ask Twitter board to retain records tied to Musk offer

sentence: "As Congress continues to examine Big Tech and how to best protect Americans' free speech rights, this letter serves as a formal request that you preserve all records and materials relating to Musk's offer to purchase Twitter, including Twitter's consideration and response to this offer, and Twitter's evaluation of its shareholder interests with respect to Musk's offer," said the letter, led by ranking member Jim Jordan, R-Ohio.
author: Lauren Feiner
title: House Republicans Demand Twitter's Board Preserve All Records About Musk's Bid to Buy the Company

sentence: Big Tech in the Crosshairs "As Congress continues to examine Big Tech and how to best protect Americans’ free speech rights, this letter serves as a formal request that you preserve all records and materials relating to Musk’s offer to purchase Twitter, including Twitter’s consideration and response to this offer, and Twitter’s evaluation of its shareholder interests with respect to Musk’s offer," said the letter signed by the top Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, Jim Jordan, and others on the committee.
title: House Republicans Ask Twitter to Retain Musk Records

sentence: “As Congress continues to examine Big Tech and how to best protect Americans’ free speech rights, this letter serves as a formal request that you preserve all records and materials relating to Musk’s offer to purchase Twitter, including Twitter’s consideration and response to this offer, and Twitter’s evaluation of its shareholder interests with respect to Musk’s offer,” said the letter, led by ranking member Jim Jordan, R-Ohio.
author: Lauren Feiner
title: House Republicans demand Twitter’s board preserve all records about Musk’s bid to buy the company
